title: Keen Fest 2006
content:
I'm 16 years old and i've been playing Keen all my life. My dad got it for my big sister when she was 3 and I started playing it when i was about 4 or 5. Every so often i'd always come back to the games and 3 years ago my sister and I started what we called Keen Fest. During summer vacation we (on seperate computers) would do a keen marathon playing every level of all six games (excluding keen dreams) on hard over a 48 hour period with 1 save allowed every 20 minutes in 4,5, and 6. So far every year i've been able to beat the previous years scores.

In short it's a monumental task of incredibly nerdy love. That's why tonight after finishing the ,still, astonishingly difficult Invasion of the Vorticons trilogy I decided to google search Commander Keen and I found this board. Can't believe I didn't think of it before.

I've some questions. There must be more than just the 7 games i own otherwise this board couldn't still be active and have so many posters. Are there any third party episodes that have been made for keen, is there any news on The Universe is Toast trilogy? Can anyone link me to any good sites?

title: Re: Keen Fest 2006
content:
- There are many Keen fangames and mods in existence. Refer to the link below

- TUIT has not happened.

- [url=http://dosclassics.com/keen/]dosclassics.com/keen/[/url] You shall enjoy all that you see. There's plenty of fangames and mods there.

And welcome to the forums. Stay a while. I insist.

title: Re: Keen Fest 2006
content:
Indeed, you can create modifications of the existing Keen games, or attempt to program a whole new game yourself [Some not bad ones have been made actually.]

There's a regualr trickle of new mods appearing; one of the best so far has just been released; many brilliant utilities have been released and developed. We await the release of a Keen movie and Keen has appeared in numerous fan animations, at least as cameo.

Keen Fest huh? Sounds nice, Next time you must include me.

Welcome!A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

Here's my Keen mod site (that I should update soon, yes):

Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen Fest 2006
content:
Yeah i have to agree, commander keen is an incredible game.

I played commander keen lots as a kid too (better make that more than lots). We only had a 386 back then which could only play the really simple dos games (no doom etc., just games like keen, cosmo, jill etc.).

I always played keen 5 cause thats what was on my PC.

Then eventually the computer died and i didn't play keen for maybe 5 years (maybe more) and i really wanted to play it, so i opened up the 386 and tried to fix it, and with luck i did!

It was such an incredible feeling to play that game again, it brang back so many memories. I can't explain how it felt, but it felt great to be playing it again.

I enjoyed it so much i finished it twice in a row on hard [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] , this is somthing no other game has been able to do to me.

title: Re: Keen Fest 2006
content:
Sounds like fun...

You should get the community involved.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

title: Keenfest!
content:
Ooh. sounds interesting. If your'e looking for another challenge, you could try keenrush's episode smile, a keen2 modification, which is probably one of, if not the, hardest keen game.

as for unoffical games, ones which aren't mods here are some good samples:

-[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm17.showMessage?topicID=1163.topic] vitamin zach's keen alpha demo[/url]

-[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm17.showMessage?topicID=1126.topic]z hypen 1's game[/url]

[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm18.showMessage?topicID=67.topic]Keen dreams 3D[/url]

all are great efforts for games done in their spare time.

[hr]

your keenfest celerbrations soound great. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

[hr]

title: Re: Keenfest!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]During summer vacation we (on seperate computers) would do a keen marathon playing every level of all six games (excluding keen dreams) on hard over a 48 hour period with 1 save allowed every 20 minutes in 4,5, and 6. So far every year i've been able to beat the previous years scores.[hr][/quote]

How long did it take you to finish!!!??? you sure you don't mean 48 minutes?

[quote]Quote:[hr]Well I might have to, right now i'm having trouble. Keen 4 played without any problem but both keen 5 and 6 won't play sound, only windows sound effects. I don't know why i probably played them 3 months ago on the same machine but my dos is decaying does anyone know how i can do these on an XP machine. I need to finish these by noon tommorow![hr][/quote]

Sounds like a problem i used to have. Windows XP is bad for running dos games. Try downloading a program called 'DOSBox'. Its basically a program that plays dos games. Its much smoother, fixes sound/music problems in XP, has AA support and lets you record.

You can find it [url=http://dosbox.sourceforge.net/download.php?main=1&begaming_website_session=cf236d48dcd160b0f97acbb5c040b5d8]here.[/url]
